在这一意义上,柏拉图和康德一样是一个雄辩家(rhetorician)。 5.遗憾的是,传统的西方哲学因为把真理视为一种绝对的、形而上学思辨的产物,所以,修辞学要么被假想.

list.abs: this steep-sloped amphitheater was built around A.D. 160 by Greek philosopher and rhetorician Herodes Atticus as a tribute to his wife .大约公元前160年，希腊哲学家及雄辩家希罗德·阿提库斯建造了这座陡坡式的露天剧院，以纪念他的妻子。
Lucius Coelius Antipater - jurist, rhetorician和历史学家 Gaius Coelius Caldus - 执政官 Lucius Junius Moderatus Columella - 农民及作家 Cominianus -.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French rethoricien, from rhetorique (see rhetoric)

entry.tran: 修辞学家;演说家;雄辩家
entry.def: A rhetorician is a person who is good at public speaking or who is trained in the art of rhetoric.

example.tran: 一位才华出众、极好争论的雄辩家

means.word_mean: 1. a person who delivers a speech or oration

auth_sentence.content: A sophisticated rhetorician, inebriated with the exuberance of his own verbosity.
auth_sentence.res_content: A sophisticated rhetorician, inebriated with the exuberance of his own verbosity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A sophisticated rhetorician, inebriated with the exuberance of his own verbosity.

auth_sentence.content: Obama is an orator, for one thing a rhetorician of the old school.
auth_sentence.res_content: Obama is an orator, for one thing a rhetorician of the old school.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Obama is an orator, for one thing a rhetorician of the old school.

auth_sentence.content: Nor is he an extemporaneous rhetorician; in public appearances, he rarely strays from his script.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nor is he an extemporaneous rhetorician; in public appearances, he rarely strays from his script.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nor is he an extemporaneous rhetorician; in public appearances, he rarely strays from his script.
